content:
IStartWorkflow Interface

Definition

Defines a service that can be obtained from an ActivityExecutionContext for the purpose of starting a new workflow instance.

In this Article

[System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated.  Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")]
public interface IStartWorkflow

Remarks

Note

This material discusses types and namespaces that are obsolete. For more information, see Deprecated Types in Windows Workflow Foundation 4.5.

Methods

StartWorkflow(Type,Dictionary<String,Object>)

Starts the workflow of designated Type providing the running instance with a stem.Collections.DictionaryBase.Dictionary* that contains runtime parameters.

public Guid StartWorkflow (Type workflowType, System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary<string,object> namedArgumentValues);
workflowType
Type

The Type of the workflow.

namedArgumentValues
Dictionary<String,Object>

A stem.Collections.DictionaryBase.Dictionary* that contains runtime parameters for the workflow.

Returns
Guid

The instance ID of the workflow that is started.
